intro: Parosela pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered parosela, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Parosela pauciflora produces small, daisy-like flowers that are usually white or pale yellow in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
